info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Union, Pulaski, southwestern Johnson, eastern Alexander, Ballard, and northeastern Mississippi Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 512 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dongola to near Barlow to near Cairo. Movement of the line was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dongola around 515 PM CDT. Mounds around 525 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Barlow and La Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 26. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 12 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
